column5: I'm looking for a few more jerkbaits. I like my Suicks, but was thinking of something that doesn't need tuning. I'll likely get a couple more 9" Sledges. Has anyone tried the Sand Cats? Andy
I personally like my Bobbie Baits way more than my suicks.
I like my Mr T's more than Suicks..

I'll find a picture... Stacey was selling them a few years back.  Top right two are Mr T's..    I have a better picture somewhere of a big smallie that nailed the thing and the bait in the picture clearly. I'll find it.

I'll keep an eye out for them.   How do they compare to a bobbie or suick? (the only two jerks i've used).  Love the look of that glider, btw.   If its action matches its looks it must be a hell of a bait.

That's a Hughes River Glider. Price not for the faint of hear.. but it works very nice. Haven't used it too much though.. nor caught anything on it! lol  Here's a better pic of that Mr. T in Perch pattern..
Thats just a suick with a different eye position.
That's an ambitious smallmouth :-).  Just looked up the hughes glider.  Ouch. I'm too poor for one of those. For the price i'll stick to hellhounds and mantas.   Sure looks nice though.
Lets not do that to this thread as well xeon... doesn't even have the same body shape as a suick.

Thx for the suggestions. I like the look of the Mr T's. I checked them out on Pro Tackle site. Says the deep ones run down to 8'.  How deep do the regular versions run? And three sizes......8, 10, 12 "....decisions, decisions.....
